markdown.DE:
1. Nicht Passiv, sondern Aktiv formulieren 
Beispiel: OpenCage Data veröffentlicht ein Interview mit David Overton, dem Macher hinter der Stoffkarten produzierenden Firma Splashmaps. (via Twitter) 
2. Personen/Unternehmen sind Nachrichten! Deshalb ... möglichst immer mit einer Person/Unternehmen beginnen! 
3. Eine komplexe Meldung lieber in zwei Sätze aufteilen, statt mit Nebensätzen zu arbeiten.
4. Satzzeichen - auch Klammern() stehen immer ohne Leerzeichen direkt beim Wort. (DIN 5008)
markdown.EN:
1. Formulate not passive, but active. Sample: OpenCage data published an interview with David Overton, the doer behind the tissue map producing company Splashmaps. (via Twitter)  
2. People & companies are information! So start an article with e person or a company! 
3. Decomplify your sentences.
4. (Satzzeichen - auch Klammern() stehen immer ohne Leerzeichen direkt beim Wort. (DIN 5008))

categories.-- no category yet --: If you do not have any idea, which category to use.
categories.[Actual Category]: This category does not have to exist in every blog. Use this category for actual events like SOTM
categories.About us: Use seldom, then on the top
categories.Weekly exerciseEN:: Category for the German weekly exercise
categories.Mapping: Quality assurance, editors, maps for mapper, tools for mapping, tagging
categories.Community: articles from the community, that does not fit in any other category
categories.OpenStreetMap Foundation: articles about the OSMF or local OpenStreetMap chapter
categories.Maps: Changes on osm.org and osm.de maps, osm based special maps, no 08/15 map!
categories.#switch2OSM: Information about well known websites or traffic rich websites, a good new rendering style, (commercial sites) companies having own (big geo) data, more features for displaying maps are offered
categories.Software: Programs for non programmers (without OSM editors)
categories.Did you know …: Any thing which is interesting for OSM User. No longer known article and beginner tools.
categories.Other “geo” things: Information, that mostly have nothing to do with OSM...
categories.--unpublished--: Articles, that should not be published, but keep their relation to the blog (otherwise use the trash)
